oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Gary Hannan - 2017-11-18
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Gary Hannan from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 18, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Gary Hannan;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Introduction by Abi Tapia begins in progress / ((03:10) Opening comments by Gary and talks about his background / (04:44) Introduces the next song / (05:50) Performs God Knows Who I Am / (09:20) Talks about his songwriting and immigration background / (10:22) Answers question about who would he most like to have record his songs / (11:55) Introduces the next song / (12:47) Performs Heaven's Gate / (16:35) Talks about his performance anxiety / (17:20) Answers question about how he finds song ideas and music or lyrics coming first / (18:20) Answers question about his influences / (19:14) Answers question about the inspiration for the song Tequila Makes Her Clothes Fall Off / (21:18) Performs the original version of the song Tequila Makes Her Clothes Fall Off / (24:45) Answers question about his favorite song being Pancho and Lefty /

(26:29) Answers question about writing songs for specific artists and tells one of his secrets to writing / (28:02) Answers question about what songwriting is about to him / (28:10) Introduces the next song / (28:42) Performs unidentified song likely titled A Soldier's Wife / (32:36) Answers question about forgetting his lyrics / (33:22) Responds to inaudible compliment from audience member / (33:40) Answers question about Bob Dylan / (34:11) Answers question about the first time he started writing professional songs / (36:43) Introduces the next song / (37:13) Performs unidentified song likely title You're A Soldier, This Way Ain't Over Yet / (41:15) Acknowledges Jason Martin in the audience / (42:00) Talks about having two #1 songs before he ever go up to sing in front of people / (44:26) Answers question about how long ago he first sang in front of people / (45:45) Final comments / (46:05) Walk-out music / (50:06) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hannan, Gary; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
